content:
Greetings! Connectathon Track Proposals for the January 12-13, 2019 event in San Antonio will be collected here: http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=Category:201901_FHIR_Connectathon_Track_Proposals
Please complete them BEFORE November 7, 2018! We have a short cycle with the holidays coming up and we want to ensure a great event. Please let me know if you have any questions.

4:54 PM

Greetings! Connectathon Track Proposals for the January 12-13, 2019 event in San Antonio will be collected here: http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=Category:201901_FHIR_Connectathon_Track_Proposals
Please complete them BEFORE November 7, 2018! We have a short cycle with the holidays coming up and we want to ensure a great event. Please let me know if you have any questions.
Assume then that it is BEYOND TOO LATE to try and consider a Dental Interoperability track ... correct? [and yes, I wasn't paying very good attention, ya think?!]
We're generally pretty lenient :)

Great - I'll sync with the ADA on Monday and if we are "thumbs up" for the CAT or Clinicians on FHIR (or both), I'll draft up a quick proposal to get it on the map and see if I can recruit some participants - stay tuned.
The Wiki page (http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=FHIR_Connectathon_20) still references the Baltimore tracks . . .
and is the list there accurate?
@David Hay ?

oops - I'll look into it
@Sandra Vance ?

A reminder that the ‘early bird’ registration for the January Working Group Meeting in San Antonio this January ends on December 21st – and with it the 30% discount on the event – and especially the 20th connectathon!

The wiki page has been updated so make sure you get your reservation in...
For getting numbers of expected participants, are we using Con Man exclusively this round? Or the tracking spreadsheet?
Note that the link to both is broken from the current connectathon page...
The spreadsheet link goes to the 2018 Baltimore spreadsheet, and the con man link gives me an error that that event code is not set up.

Here's the correct url - http://conman.fhir.org/connectathon.html?event=sanant2019 . (I'll update the wiki page - thanks for pointing that out!

Up to the track leads to decide if they want to use it - I do need to add all the tracks to it (which I'll do in a day or so) - I doubt that we'll set up the tracking spreadsheet (though nothing stopping a track lead doing that if they prefer it)...
(BTW - if you go to the page make sure you click the 'All' button to show all the tracks - currently it defaults to only showing clinical ones - I'll change the default in a little bit...
Oh - wrt expected participants, Sandy will be sending out a survey - we encourage people to update conman as well, though we don't require it...
OK - all done.
Great, thank you!

@David Hay - the Terminology Services Track will definitely use ConMan again (and I've just updated the link on our Wiki Page). Is it possible to copy over the relevant entries from the Baltimore Sept 2018 version to save re-entering all the scenarios, etc?
For you Peter - of course!
Thanks, David.
Here is S&A track proposal - http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=201901_FHIR_Storage_and_Analytics

@nicola (RIO/SS) - have added the track to conman. Feel free to use the tool to manage user registrations . (Just get users to register with the app - then set their primary track to yours - or a track of interest)
Thank you!

@Peter Jordan - All done - can you check that it's complete? Feel free to modify as needed...

I wrote an import/export function for this, so can do for anyone else who has previous tracks they want to transfer...
The Clinical Reasoning scenarios are very similar, it would be great if those were brought forward. Thank you!
Many thanks @David Hay! When time permits, could you please amend the Details Page, on the Descriptions Tab, to point to the 201901 version of the Wiki Page for the Track.
